sen.e: TAIMA no Kunimi (or TAGIMA no Kunimi) was active in the Asuka period (his age at birth and age at death are unknown).
TAIMA no Kunimi (or TAGIMA no Kunimi, date of birth and death unknown) was a figure in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 天武天皇元年（672年）の壬申の乱では大海人皇子（天武天皇）方に付き、天武・持統・文武の三代の天皇に仕えた。
sen.e: At the Jinshin War of 672, Kunimi supported Oama no Miko (Oshiama no Miko or Prince Oama who became Emperor Tenmu following the victory in the war), and he served Emperor Tenmu, Empress Jito and Emperor Monmu.

sen.j: また、当麻寺（奈良県葛城市）の開山に携わったと伝えられる。
sen.e: It has been said that Kunimi supported to build Taima-dera Temple (in present Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 壬申の乱時の国見の行動は『日本書紀』に見えないが、『続日本紀』の大宝元年（701年）7月21日条には、かつて功臣として100戸の封戸を与えられたことが記されており、天武方で何らかの活躍をしたことが分かる。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan), the description of Kunimi's role in the Jinshin War is not found, however, according to the article of July 21, 701 in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), he was given a salary of a hundred fuko (an unit) for his past achievements, therefore, presumably, he had played some important role supporting Oama no Miko in the war.

Although "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan) has no description of Kunimi's role in the Jinshin War, "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) describes that he was given a salary of a hundred fuko (100 taxed families) for his merit, which shows he played some important role fighting for Oama no Miko in its article about July 21of the first year of the Taiho era (May 7, 701).
sen.cmt: この「大宝元年（701年）7月21日」は書物に記載されている内容のため、和暦を使用し、括弧内にグレゴリオ暦を補足しました。Althoughで書き換えました。

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）10月に八色の姓が制定され、この際に当麻公姓を改め当麻真人姓を賜った。
sen.e: In October of 684 (in old lunar calendar), a new rank system Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles) was applied, and Kunimi's kabane was changed from Kimi to Mahito.

sen.j: 当麻氏は用明天皇皇子の麻呂子皇子を祖とする皇別氏族である。
sen.e: The Toma clan was branched out from the Imperial family, and originated from Maroko no Miko who was a prince of Emperor Yomei.
The Taima clan was branched out from the Imperial family, and originated from Maroko no Miko who was a prince of Emperor Yomei.

sen.j: 朱鳥元年（686年）9月27日、天武天皇の葬儀に際して、直大参の位にあった当摩国見は左右兵衛の事を誄した。
sen.e: On September 27, 686 (in old lunar calendar), at the funeral of Emperor Tenmu, as an official ranked at Yosoamariyashina (Kani Shijuhachi-kai or the forty-eight grades of cap rank), Kunimi praised the achievements of Goefu (Five Royal Guards which was formed by the new imperial guard system) in the period of Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: オリジナルに「五衛府の事を誅した」（チュウするto punish）とありましたが、正しくは「誄した」（ルイするto praise posthumously）ですので直します。「冠位・官位制度の変遷冠位四十八階の」…オリジナルに混乱がありますが、冠位四十八階の中の一つの位「直大参」を与えられている国見は…という意味です。「五衛府」…『日本書紀』該当記事には「左右兵衛Hidarimiginotoneri (the Imperial Guards)」とあります。岩波文庫『日本書紀』参照。
sen.e: On October 22, 686, at the funeral of Emperor Tenmu, ranked as Jikidaisan (the thirteenth grade of jikidai rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Shogoinojo, Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code), Kunimi delivered an eulogy for Hidarimiginotoneri (the Imperial Guards).
sen.cmt: 原文には「冠位・官位制度の変遷冠位四十八階の当摩国見は近衛兵令制の五衛府の事を」とありましたが、Web記載に合わせて、原文・訳文ともに変更しました。グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: これにより、天武朝に軍事に関わっていたことがわかる。
sen.e: Therefore, he is considered to have served Emperor Tenmu at some post in charge of the military affairs.

sen.j: 持統天皇11年（697年）2月28日、直広壱の位であった国見は東宮大傅に任じられたが、下僚として路跡見が春宮大夫、巨勢粟持が春宮亮に任じられている。
sen.e: On February 28, 697 (in old lunar calendar), as an official ranked at Yosoamariyashina, Kunimi was appointed to Mikonomiya no Okikashizuki (head teacher of the Crown Prince), and at the same time, MICHI no Tomi and KOSE no Awamochi were appointed to the assistant serving at Togubo (Mikonomiya or the Crown Prince's Quarters).
sen.cmt: オリジナルに「持統天皇10年（696年）」とありましたが、単なる写し間違いだと思われますので、直します。岩波文庫『日本書紀』・平楽寺書店『東方年表』などで確認しました。「冠位・官位制度の変遷冠位四十八階であった」…冠位四十八階の中の一つの位を与えられている国見は…という意味です。東宮大傅Mikonomiya no Okikashizuki路跡見MICHI no Tomi巨勢粟持KOSE no Awamochi
sen.e: On March 28, 697, ranked as Jikikoichi (the tenth grade of jikiko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Shoshiinoge, Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code), Kunimi was appointed to Togu no daifu (Mikonomiya no Okikashizuki, head teacher of the Crown Prince), and the appointed staff were MICHI no Tomi as Togu no daibu (Master in the Crown Prince's Quarters) and KOSE no Awamochi Togu no suke (Assistant Master in the Crown Prince's Quarters)

sen.e: On October 20, 699 (in old lunar calendar), Kunimi was ordered to repair the tomb of Empress Saimei as well as KINUNUI no Okimi, HAJI no Nemaro and TANAKA no Norimaro, and went to the tomb bring four Hangan (Kotowarutsukasa or inspector), two Sakan (Fubito or secretary), two Daiku (carpenter).
